data.title: Pop Culture, Comics, Pro Wrestling, Toys, TV, Movies, and Podcasts
data.meta_description: The Ultimate History of Pro Wrestling - 1979. Toys, TV, Movies, Music, Wrestling, Cartoons, Retro... #WhenItWasCool
data.meta_site_name: When It Was Cool - Pop Culture, Comics, Pro Wrestling, Toys, TV, Movies, and Podcasts
data.text:
01-01-1979: In Atlanta, GA at the Omni: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race battled Andre the Giant to a double count out… Jack & Jerry Brisco defeat Terry & Dory Funk, Jr. in Atlanta for the NWA Georgia tag team titles… Dusty Rhodes & Tommy Rich defeated Ernie Ladd & Stan Hansen by DQ… Wahoo McDaniel defeated Angelo Mosca… Thunderbolt Patterson defeated Luke Graham… Bugsy McGraw defeated Kurt Von Hess… Pierre Lefevre defeated Bryan St. John… Raymond Rougeau defeated Larry Latham (AKA: Moondog Spot)

In West Palm Beach, FL Dick Slater defeated Jos LeDuc for the Florida title.

01-02-1979: Randy Alls (AKA: Randy Rose of Midnight Express fame) defeats Dick Murdoch for the NWA Central States title in St. Joseph, MO.

In Tampa, FL at the Fort Hesterly Armory: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race battled Terry Funk to a draw.

Bruiser Brody starts his first tour of All Japan Pro Wrestling.

01-03-1979: In Miami Beach, Fl at the Convention Center: NWA World champion Harley Race defeated Jos LeDuc.

01-05-1979: St Louis, MO: Kiel Auditorium: Attendance 9,812: Mike Bowyer wrestled Randy Alls (AKA: Randy Rose) to a draw… Hartford Love defeats Rick Oliver… Joyce Grable & Vicki Williams defeat Suzette Ferreira & Leilani Kai 2 falls to 1… Ted DiBiase defeats Roger Kirby… Bobo Brazil & Tom Andrews & Pat O'Connor defeat Lord Alfred Hayes & Bob Sweetan & Bobby Duncum… NWA World Heavyweight champion Harley Race defeats Dick the Bruiser by Count Out 2 falls to 1.

01-06-1979: Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) defeats Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) for the NWA Georgia title. Also Thunderbolt Patterson defeats Gene Anderson for the NWA Georgia TV title.

01-07-1979: Michael Hayes & Terry Gordy win the Mid America tag team titles from George Gulas & Bobby Eaton in Chattanooga, TN.

Houston, TX: The Summit: Bull Ramos defeated Nick Kozak… Tiger Conway Jr. wrestled Superstar Billy Graham to a 20 minute draw… Ox Baker defeated Gino Hernandez by DQ… Dusty Rhodes defeats NWA Texas Brass Knuckles championMark Lewin to win the title… Jose Lothario & Mil Mascaras defeats The Funk Brothers (Dory Funk Jr. & Terry Funk) 2 falls to 1… NWA World Heavyweight champion Harley Race wrestled Andre The Giant to a double count out. Harley Race won one fall by count out. Andre won the second fall. The third fall went to a double count out. Harley Race body slammed Andre the Giant during this match.

01-11-1979: AWA Wrestling: Winnipeg, Canada: Arena: Attendance: 11,000: Verne Gagne & Mad Dog Vachon defeated Pat Patterson & Ray Stevens… Mighty Igor defeated Super Destroyer Mark II (Robert Remus)… Bobby Duncum & Stan Hansen defeated High Fliers (Greg Gagne & Jim Brunzell)… Billy Robinson defeated Iron Sheik… Moose Morowski battled Steve Olsonoski to a draw… Frank Hill defeated Doug Sommers.

05-04-1979: Ron Slinker defeats David Schultz for the Gulf Coast title in Dothan, AL.

05-05-1979: WWWF: Springfield, MA: Civic Center: Attendance: 9,125: Steve Travis defeated Johnny Rodz… Nikolai Volkoff defeated Mike Hall… Jimmy Valiant defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… Little Tokyo & Butch Cassidy defeated Cowboy Lang & Tiny Thumb… Greg Valentine defeated WWF champion Bob Backlund via DQ… Dave Darrow defeated Mr. X… Pete Doherty defeated Steve King… Hussein Arab (Iron Sheik) defeated SD Jones… WWF North American champion Ted DiBiase defeated Jerry Valiant… Bulldog Brower defeated Dominic DeNucci… Bruno Sammartino defeated Johnny Valiant when the match was stopped due to blood.

05-06-1979: AWA: Minneapolis, MN: Auditorium: Attendance 8,870: Buddy Wolff wrestled Doug Gilbert to a Draw… Jesse Ventura wrestled Paul Ellering to a No Contest… Bobby Duncum defeats Steve Olsonoski… Greg Gagne defeats Cecil DuBois… The Super Destroyer Mark II (Bob “Sgt. Slaughter” Remus) defeats Billy Robinson by DQ… Steel Cage Match: Mad Dog Vachon & Verne Gagne defeat The Blond Bombers (Pat Patterson & Ray Stevens).

05-07-1979: In Memphis, TN at the Mid-South Coliseum: Bill Dundee & Robert Fuller beat The Assassins (Don Bass & Roger Smith) in a loser leaves town vs. title match to win the Southern tag team titles.

05-12-1979: WWF: Baltimore, MD: Civic Center: Attendance: 7,200: Nikolia Volkoff defeated Johnny Rivera… Tito Santana defeated Johnny Rodz… Cowboy Lang & Tiny Thumb defeated Little Tokyo & Butch Cassidy… WWF champion Bob Backlund fought Greg Valentine to a no contest… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated SD Jones… WWF North American champion Ted DiBiase defeated Jimmy Valiant via DQ… WWF tag team champions Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated Steve Travis & Dominic DeNucci… Ivan Putski defeated Bulldog Brower via count-out.

05-14-1979: Wahoo McDaniel defeated The Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) for the Georgia title in Augusta, GA. Also on the card Blackjack Mulligan defeated Bob Armstrong for the Georgia TV title.

In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 5,300: Tommy Gilbert beat Danny Davis… Kevin Charles beat Plowboy Frazier… Dick Slater beat Kevin Sullivan… Toru Tanaka & Mr. Fuji beat Bill Dundee & Robert Fuller to win the Southern tag team titles… Terry Boulder (AKA: Hulk Hogan) beat Southern champion The Mongolian Stomper via DQ… Jerry Lawler beat Jimmy Golden in a no DQ loser leaves town match.

05-16-1979: In Tampa, FL King Curtis defeated Jimmy Garvin for the Florida title.

Later that night in Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes by DQ.

05-17-1979: In Jacksonville, FL at the Coliseum: NWA World champion Harley Race defeated Jimmy Garvin.

05-18-1979: Tommy Rich & Wahoo McDaniel defeat Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff for the NWA Georgia tag team titles in a tournament finals at the Omni in Atlanta, GA. The Double Cadillac Georgia tag team title tournament: Round 1: Blackjack Lanza & Ron Bass defeated Bob Armstrong & Robert Fuller… Dusty Rhodes & Dick Slater defeated Pak Song & Kim Duk… Wahoo McDaniel & Tommy Rich defeated Jack & Jerry Brisco… Mr. Wrestling (Tim Woods) & Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) defeated The Masked Superstars… Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff defeated Ray Candy & Norvel Austin… Second Round: Blackjack Lanza & Ron Bass defeated Dusty Rhodes & Dick Slater by DQ… Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff defeated Mr. Wrestling & Mr. Wrestling II… Round 3: Wahoo McDaniel & Tommy Rich defeated Blackjack Lanza & Ron Bass… also on the show: Lou Thesz defeated Luke Graham.

Southeastern Championship Wrestling in Knoxville, TN: Mr. Fuji pinned Terry Gibbs… Southern champion Mongolian Stomper pinned Ken Lucas… Southeastern tag team champions Bob Roop & Bob Orton, Jr. beat Jerry Blackwell & Dean Ho… Alexis Smirnoff defeated Ronnie Garvin to win the Southeastern title… Kevin Sullivan pinned Mike Graham to win the U.S. Junior Heavyweight title… CWA champion Thunderbolt Patterson beat Boris Malenko… NWA World champion Harley Race battled Ron Fuller to a double DQ.

05-26-1979: In St. Petersburg, FL at the Bayfront Center: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Steve Keirn on a reverse decision.

WWF: Philadelphia, PA: Spectrum: Attendance: 9,085: Johnny Rivera fought Mr. X to a draw… Dominic DeNucci defeated Johnny Rodz… Nikolai Volkoff defeated Frank Williams… Bulldog Brower defeated SD Jones… WWF champion Bob Backlund defeated Greg Valentine via referee's decision. Haystacks Calhoun was the special referee… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated Jose Estrada… WWF tag team champions Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated Steve Travis & Gorilla Monsoon… Tito Santana defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… WWF North American champion Ted DiBiase fought Jimmy Valiant to a draw.

06-04-1979: WWF at Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 17,000: The Great Hossien (AKA: Iron Sheik) won a 20 man battle royal… WWF champion Bob Backlund defeated Great Hossien… Tito Santana defeated Jose Estrada… Nikolai Volkoff defeated S.D. Jones… Greg Valentine defeated Dominic DeNucci… Jimmy Valiant battled Ted DiBiase to a draw… Bulldog Brower defeated Mr. X… Ivan Putski defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated Haystack Calhoun & Steve Travis.

In Memphis, TN at the Mid-South Coliseum: Jerry Lawler & Bill Dundee beat Mr. Fuji & Toru Tanaka to win the Southern tag team titles… Robert Fuller beat The Mongolian Stomper in a loser leaves town vs. title match to win the Southern title.

06-07-1979: New Japan Pro Wrestling: in Tokyo, Japan: Sumo Hall drawing 9,500: Chavo Guerrero beat Kuniaki Kobayashi… Strong Kobayashi & Kengo Kimura beat Victor Rivera & Larry Zbyszko… Mr. Ito beat Haruka Eigen… Seiji Sakaguchi & Riki Choshu & Osamu Kido beat Andre the Giant & Masa Saito & Tony Garea… WWF Junior Heavyweight champion Tatsumi Fujinami pinned El Canek… Antonio Inoki pinned Stan Hansen to win the 2nd Annual MSG League.

06-08-1979: Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff defeat Tommy Rich & Wahoo McDaniel for the NWA Georgia tag team titles in Atlanta, GA.

06-09-1979: WWF: Boston, MA: Boston Garden: Attendance: 7,850: Jose Estrada defeated Steve King… Johnny Rodz fought Baron Mikel Scicluna to a draw… Tito Santana defeated Mr. X… Nikolai Volkoff defeated Mike Hall… Bulldog Brower defeated SD Jones… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated Frank Williams… Bulldog Brower defeated Frank Williams… Jimmy & Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated Ted DiBiase & Dominic DeNucci & Haystacks Calhoun… WWF champion Bob Backlund fought Greg Valentine to a double DQ.

06-10-1979: Ricky Steamboat defeats Paul Jones for the NWA TV title in Asheville, NC.

06-11-1979: The first ever Tupelo, Mississippi concession stand brawl takes place during a Jerry Jarrett promoted show at the Sports Arena. The Blonde Bombers (Larry Latham & Wayne Ferris) win the Southern tag team titles from Jerry Lawler & Bill Dundee then the two teams brawl their way back to the concession stand where it is filmed for television. The brawl is finally broken up by Jerry Jarrett and others. The promotion would do similar brawls multiple times in the future. The next one would take place on April 11, 1980.

06-15-1979: In Atlanta, GA at the Omni: In a No DQ match: Bill Watts & Tommy Rich & Wahoo McDaniel defeated Ernie Ladd & Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff… In a Lumberjack match: Dusty Rhodes defeated Bobby Heenan by DQ… Bob Armstrong & Tony Atlas defeated Blackjack Lanza & Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) by DQ… Tony Atlas defeated Masked Superstar… Stan Hansen defeated Gene Anderson… Mr. Wrestling (Tim Woods) defeated Kurt Von Hess… Ray Candy & Norvell Austin defeated Doug Somers & Carl Fergie… Mike Stallings defeated Bill Howard… Jerry Roberts (Jacques Rougeau) defeated Mike Hammer.

St. Louis, MO: Kiel Auditorium: Attendance 11,000: Bryan St. John & Frank Hill defeat The Turk & Steve Hall 2 falls to 1… Bulldog Brown defeats Tom Andrews… Kevin Von Erich & Rufus R. Jones defeat Jerry Brown & Bob Sweetan… Dick Murdoch defeats Pat O'Connor… NWA Missouri champion Dick the Bruiser defeats King Kong (Bruiser) Brody by DQ… NWA World Heavyweight champion Harley Race defeats David Von Erich 2 falls to 1.

06-17-1979: Buddy Rogers referees an NWA US. title match between champion Ric Flair and Dusty Rhodes. Rhodes win the match and the title, but the NWA reverses the decision on the grounds that Rogers was not an impartial referee in Greensboro NC: Attendance 9,321: Plus: Coco Samoa defeated Tony Russo… Les Thornton & Leo Burke defeated Kim Duk & Mr. X 1… Len Denton & Rudy Kay defeated Don Kernodle & Gary Young… Jim Brunzell defeated Moose Morowski…. Canadian Heavyweight Champion Dino Bravo defeated Mid-Atlantic Heavyweight Champion Ken Patera via disqualification… Ricky Steamboat defeated NWA World Heavyweight champion Harley Race by DQ 2 falls to 1.

06-18-1979: New Japan Pro Wrestling: in Karachi, Pakistan drawing 25,000: Antonio Inoki drew Tiger Jeet Singh.

06-19-1979: Pat Patterson defeats Ted DiBiase for the WWF North American title in Allentown, PA. By September, the title is replaced by the WWF Intercontinental title which Patterson wins in a fictional Brazilian tournament.

06-23-1979: WWF: Philadelphia, PA: Spectrum: Attendance: 9,060: Johnny Rivera pinned Jose Estrada… Nikolai Volkoff pinned Johnny Rodz… Steve Travis pinned Baron Mikel Scicluna… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) pinned SD Jones… Ivan Putski defeated Lou Albano via count-out… WWF champion Bob Backlund pinned Bulldog Brower… Tito Santana pinned Mr. X… Jimmy & Jerry & Johnny Valiant defeated Ted DiBiase & Dominic DeNucci & Gorilla Monsoon… Greg Valentine defeated Haystacks Calhoun via count-out.

06-26-1979: In Tampa, FL at the Fort Hesterly Armory: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Jimmy Garvin.

06-27-1979: In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes by DQ.

06-30-1979: Olympic medalist and former AWA wrestler Chris Taylor dies at the age of 29 in Story City, IA.

WWF: Pittsburgh, PA: Civic Arena: Attendance: 10,000: Jim Grabmire pinned Ronnie Lee… Baron Mikel Scicluna pinned Nick Busick… WWF champion Bob Backlund pinned Johnny Valiant… Dominic DeNucci defeated Nikolai Volkoff via DQ… Ted DiBiase fought Jimmy Valiant to a double DQ… Johnny DeFazio pinned JoJo Andrews… Bruno Sammartino pinned Jerry Valiant.

07-01-1979: In Orlando, FL NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Steve Keirn by DQ.

07-02-1979: WWF at Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 20,055: Pat Patterson defeated WWF champion Bob Backlund by count out… Greg Valentine defeated Chief Jay Strongbow by count out… Ivan Putski defeated Bulldog Brower… Jimmy & Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated Haystack Calhoun & Ted DiBiase & Steve Travis… Great Hossien (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated Dominic DeNucci… Tito Santana defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… Nikolai Volkoff defeated S.D. Jones… Mr. X battled Johnny Rivera to a draw.

07-06-1979: At the Omni in Atlanta, GA: Wahoo McDaniel defeated Ernie Ladd… Dusty Rhodes & Bobo Johnson defeated Killer Karl Kox & Bobby Heenan… In a Texas Death Match: Tommy Rich defeated Ole Anderson with Ray Candy as special referee… In a Texas Tornado match: Stan Hansen & Tony Atlas defeated Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) & Blackjack Lanza… Bobo Brazil defeated Ivan Koloff… Missouri Mauler defeated Jerry Brisco… Mr. Wrestling (Tim Woods) defeated Carl Fergie… Candy Rich & Jerry Roberts (Jacques Rougeau) defeated Fabulous Moolah & Bill Howard… Jerry Roberts battled Genichiro Tenryu to a draw.

07-07-1979: Terry Gordy & Michael Hayes lose their first match in Chattanooga, TN to Tojo Yamamoto & Great Togo.

WWF: Baltimore, MD: Civic Center: Attention: 8,200: Jose Estrada fought Steve King to a draw… Dominic DeNucci defeated Moose Monroe… SD Jones defeated Joe Mascara… Jerry Valiant defeated Steve Travis… Jimmy Valiant defeated Ivan Putski… Tito Santana defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated Johnny Rivera… WWF champion Bob Backlund pinned Greg Valentine.

07-08-1979: In the famous “Battle of the Nature Boys”, Ric Flair defeats Buddy Rogers with the figure four leg lock in Greensboro, NC. In other matches: Gary Young pinned Tony Russo… Les Thornton drew Mr. X… Tony Garea beat Charlie Fulton… Johnny Weaver & Jay Youngblood beat Gene Anderson & Swede Hanson… Jim Brunzell & Rufus R. Jones beat Big John Studd & Ken Patera… Dusty Rhodes battled Ernie Ladd to a double count out… Ricky Steamboat beat NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race via DQ.

07-09-1979: In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 5,440: Steve Regal beat Pete Austin via DQ… Hans Schroeder & The Gestapo beat Ricky Morton & Dallas Montgomery… Tommy & Eddie Gilbert beat Buddy & Ken Wayne via DQ in an elimination match… Jackie Fargo & Jerry Lawler & Bill Dundee beat Larry Latham & Wayne Ferris & Pete Austin… Bill Dundee beat Danny Davis in a hair vs. hair match… Southern champion Ron Bass beat Randy Tyler.

07-11-1979: In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: Attendance: 5,460: Dusty Rhodes defeated King Curtis by DQ in a cage match… Steve Keirn & Jimmy Garvin defeated Jos LeDuc & Don Muraco by DQ… Killer Khan defeated Sweet Brown Sugar (Skip Young)… Jimmy Garvin defeated Thor the Viking (Bill Irwin)… Bugsy McGraw defeated Reggie Parks… Buzz Sawyer defeated Mike Hammer.

07-15-1979: Toronto, Canada: Maple Leaf Gardens: Dewey Robertson defeats John Forsythe… Tiger Jeet Singh defeats Brian Mackney… Paul Orndorff & Jay Youngblood defeat Gene Anderson & Swede Hanson… Jim Brunzell defeats Greg Valentine… Ricky Steamboat defeats Ernie Ladd… NWA Canadian Heavyweight champion Dino Bravo wrestled. Ken Patera to a double DQ… WWF Heavyweight Title vs NWA United States Heavyweight Title Match: Bob Backlund (WWF champion) defeats Ric Flair (NWA U.S. champion) by count out.

07-16-1979: In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 6,751: Ken Wayne drew Ricky Morton… Randy Tyler & Eddie Gilbert beat Hans Schroeder & The Gestapo… Steve Regal beat The Hangman… Buddy Wayne pinned Tommy Gilbert in a no DQ match… Terry & Eddie Boulder (AKA: Hulk Hogan & Ed Leslie) beat Ron Bass & Pete Austin… Southern tag team champions Larry Latham & Wayne Ferris beat Jerry Lawler & Bill Dundee via DQ.

07-21-1979: In New Orleans, LA: The Superdome drawing 15,000: Mike Bowyer beat Ken Lucas… John Tolos & Mike George beat Stan Lane & Billy Starr… Jerry Oates beat Tank Patton… Charlie Cook pinned Luke Graham… Vickie Williams won a battle royal. Also in the match were: Kitty Adams, Fabulous Moolah, Winona Littleheart, Cindy Major, Judy Martin, Candy Rich, Toni Rose, Vivian St. John, and Lilly Thomas… Mike Sharpe pinned Ivan Koloff… Angelo Mosca beat Paul Orndorff… Dusty Rhodes beat Karl Kox… Mid-South North American champion Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) beat Ernie Ladd via DQ… Mid-South Louisiana tag team champions Bill Watts & Buck Robley beat The Assassin & The Angel in a steel cage match to win the Mid-South U.S. tag team title.

WWF: Philadelphia, PA: Spectrum: Attendance: 16,232: Televised on the PRISM Network… Tito Santana defeated Johnny Rodz… Baron Mikel Scicluna defeated Jose Estrada… SD Jones defeated Joe Mascara… Greg Valentine defeated Chief Jay Strongbow via count-out… Bulldog Brower defeated Johnny Rivera… WWF tag team champions Johnny & Jerry Valiant defeated WWF champion Bob Backlund & Ivan Putski… Hussein Arab (AKA: Iron Sheik) defeated Dominic DeNucci… Jimmy Valiant defeated Steve Travis… WWF North American champion Pat Patterson pinned Ted DiBiase.

07-23-1979: In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 6,982: Ricky Morton & Eddie Gilbert beat The Hangman & Ken Wayne… Randy Tyler & Steve Regal beat Hans Schroeder & Gestapo… Buddy Wayne pinned Tommy Gilbert in a taped fist match… World Women's champion The Fabulous Moolah battled Vivian St. John to a double DQ… Jerry Lawler & Bill Dundee beat The Freebirds (Terry Gordy & Michael Hayes)… Jackie & Roughhouse Fargo battled Larry Latham & Wayne Ferris & Danny Davis to a no contest in a handicap match… Terry & Eddie Boulder (AKA: Hulk Hogan & Ed Leslie) beat Ron Bass & Pete Austin.

07-25-1979: In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: Attendance: 6,288: King Curtis & Killer Khan defeated Dusty Rhodes & Sweet Brown Sugar (Skip Young) by DQ… Jack Brisco defeated Don Muraco… Jimmy Garvin defeated Jos LeDuc by DQ… Steve Keirn & Jerry Brisco defeated Bugsy McGraw & Thor the Viking (Bill Irwin)… Buzz Sawyer battled Jim Shields to a draw… Reggie Parks defeated Mike Hammer.

07-27-1979: At the Omni in Atlanta, GA: Dusty Rhodes & Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) defeated Ole Anderson & Ivan Koloff… Andre the Giant defeated Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie)… Wahoo McDaniel defeated The Sheik… Ray Candy defeated Blackjack Lanza by DQ… Bill Watts defeated Bobby Duncum… Bob Armstrong & Stan Hansen defeated Killer Karl Kox & Austin Idol… Jerry Brisco defeated Doug Somers… Mike Stallings defeated Carl Fergie… Jerry Stubbs defeated Bill Howard.

07-28-1979: Nelson Royal is awarded the NWA World Junior in Atlanta, GA.

Kevin Sullivan defeats Mike Graham in title when champion Al Madril is unable to defend it due to illness.

07-30-1979: WWF at Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance:18,000: WWF champion Bob Backlund battled Pat Patterson to a double count out… Chief Jay Strongbow battled Greg Valentine to a no contest in an Indian Strap Match… Andre the Giant & Ivan Putski & Tito Santana & Dominic DeNucci defeated Jimmy & Johnny & Jerry Valiant & Lou Albano… Ted DiBiase battled Great Hossien (Iron Sheik) to a draw… Roddy Piper defeated Johnny Rodz… Nikolai Volkoff defeated Jose Estrada… Steve Travis defeated Baron Mikel Scicluna… Fabulous Moolah & Kitty Adams defeated Joyce Grable & Vivian St. John.

In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 7,618: Southern champion Ron Bass beat Terry Boulder (AKA: Hulk Hogan)… AWA World champion Nick Bockwinkel beat Bill Dundee.

Masked Superstar defeats Wahoo McDaniel for the NWA Georgia title in Augusta, GA. Also on the show Ray Candy wins the NWA Georgia TV title from Blackjack Lanza.

In Sarasota, FL at the Robarts Arena: NWA World champion Harley Race defeated Mike Graham.

07-31-1979: Bull Martin (Murray Grondin) dies of a heart attack at the age of 34 following a match in St. Johns, Newfoundland, Canada.

07-1979: One of the most popular wrestling magazines of all time Pro Wrestling Illustrated debuts with a photo of Mil Mascaras & Dusty Rhodes dominating the cover.

09-08-1979: George Gulas & Bobby Eaton defeat Tojo Yamamoto & David Schultz for the Mid America tag teams titles.

09-09-1979: Dewey Robertson defeated Greg Valentine for the NWA Canadian title in a tournament final in Toronto, Canada.

09-14-1979: Jim Brunzell wins the NWA Mid Atlantic title from Ken Patera in Richmond, VA... Ray Candy wins the NWA Georgia TV title from Lord Jonathan Boyd in Atlanta.

St. Louis, MO: Kiel Auditorium: Attendance 11,051: George Wells & Frank Hill defeat Roger Kirby & Steve Hall 2 falls to 1… Ron Starr defeats The Turk… David Von Erich defeats Bulldog Bob Brown… Dick The Bruiser & Kevin Von Erich & Pat O'Connor defeat Lord Alfred Hayes & Bob Sweetan & Bobby Duncum… NWA Missouri champion Dick Murdoch wrestled Dory Funk Jr. - Draw… Andre The Giant defeats King Kong (Bruiser) Brody by DQ… 16 Man Battle Royal: King Kong (Bruiser) Brody defeats Kevin Von Erich; Steve Hall; Bob Sweetan; Dick Murdoch; Andre The Giant; The Turk; Frank Hill; Ron Starr; Dory Funk Jr.; Lord Alfred Hayes; Bulldog Brown; George Wells; David von Erich; Roger Kirby; Bobby Duncum.

09-17-1979: In Memphis, TN at the Mid-South Coliseum: Bill Dundee beat Ron Bass in a no DQ match to win the held-up Southern title

09-19-1979: In Jackson, MS: Mike Sharpe defeated Mike George to win the Mississippi title.

In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: Attendance: 5,486: Dusty Rhodes & Sweet Brown Sugar (Skip Young) battled Terry Funk & Bugsy McGraw to a double DQ… Mr. Hito & Mr. Sakaruda defeated Buzz Sawyer & Steve Keirn… Ray Stevens defeated Killer Khan by DQ… Manny Fernandez defeated Bryan St. John… Buzz Sawyer & Mark Totten defeated Raul Mata & Don Serrano… Ray Steele defeated Reggie Parks… Jerry Roberts defeated Mike Hammer.

09-21-1979: In Atlanta, GA at the Omni: In a Lights Out Match: Bill Watts defeated Ernie Ladd… In a Steel Cage Match: Tommy Rich & The Crusher defeated Ivan Koloff & Ole Anderson to win the Georgia tag team titles… Tony Atlas defeated Killer Karl Kox… The Sheik defeated Ray Candy… Bob Armstrong defeated Toru Tanaka… Rick Oliver & Jonathan Boyd defeated Ricky Fields & Bill Dromo… Buzz Sawyer defeated Carl Fergie.

EMLL: 46th Anniversary Show: in Mexico City, Mexico: Arena Colieso: NWA World Middleweight champion Satoru Sayama beat Ringo Mendoza… Gran Cochisse beat Americo Rocca in a hair vs. hair match.

09-24-1979: WWF at Madison Square Garden in New York City, NY: Attendance: 20,255: WWF champion Bob Backlund defeated Pat Patterson in a steel cage match… Andre the Giant & Tito Santana defeated Jimmy & Jerry Valiant… Ivan Putski defeated Johnny Valiant by DQ… Greg Valentine defeated Dominic DeNucci… Chief Jay Strongbow battled Nikolai Volkoff to a draw… Ted DiBiase defeated Jose Estrada… Baron Mikel Scicluna defeated S.D. Jones by count out… Johnny Rivera defeated Frank Rodriguez… Johnny Rodz defeated Steve King.

In West Palm Beach, FL: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Manny Fernandez.

09-25-1979: In Tampa, FL at the Fort Hesterly Armory: Dusty Rhodes defeated NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race in a non-title death match.

09-26-1979: In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes by DQ.

09-28-1979: In Shreveport, LA in a singles match Mike George defeated Buck Robley. By match stipulation Mike George wins the Mid-South tag team titles for himself and partner Bob Sweetan.

09-29-1979: In St. Petersburg, FL: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Steve Keirn.

09-1979: Pat Patterson is awarded the WWF Intercontinental title. The television storyline is that he won a tournament in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil for the title (possibly to unify the North & South American titles) but no such tournament ever took place.

11-08-1979: Seiji Sakaguchi defeats Pat Patterson for the WWF North American championship, the predecessor to today’s WWF Intercontinental title. The WWF had stopped recognizing the title but Sakaguchi continues to defend the title until early 1981.

11-10-1979: San Francisco, CA: Cow Palace: Attendance: 6,420: Bob Sweetan beat Ron Starr… George Wells beat The Assassin… Chavo Guerrero & Pepper Gomez beat Masked Intern & Steve Winters… Steve Strong beat Twin Devil… Pat Barrett beat Masked Avenger… Jerry Monti beat Mablo Cordoza.

11-12-1979: Jerry Lawler defeats Superstar Billy Graham for the Memphis CWA World title in Memphis.

In Alexandria, LA Bill Watts & Buck Robley defeated Mike George & Bob Sweetan to win the Mid-South tag team titles. (May have been a phantom title change and location is not certain.)

11-16-1979: Buddy Rose wins his first Pacific Northwest title from Stan Stasiak.

11-19-1979: In Memphis, TN at the Mid-South Coliseum: Hector Guerrero & Steve Regal beat Wayne Ferris & Larry Latham to win the Southern tag team titles… AWA World champion Nick Bockwinkel beat Sonny King.

11-21-1979: In Miami Beach, FL at the Convention Center: Attendance: 5,790: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes… Manny Fernandez battled Super Destroyer (Scott Irwin) to a double count out… Bryan St. John & Stan Lane & Super Destroyer defeated Mike Graham & Steve Keirn & Jerry Brisco… Sweet Brown Sugar (Skip Young) defeated Bugsy McGraw by DQ… Jack Brisco defeated Killer Khan… Leroy Brown defeated Raul Mata & Don Serrano in a handicap match… The Gestapo defeated Mike Miller.

11-22-1979: At the Omni in Atlanta, GA: Georgia tag team title tournament: Round 1: Jack & Jerry Brisco defeated Bobby Jaggers & Luke Graham… Ricky Fields & Buzz Sawyer defeated Mr. Hito & Mr. Sakaruda… Austin Idol & Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) defeated Stan Hansen & Wahoo McDaniel… Tony Atlas & Ray Candy defeated Ox Baker & Killer Khan… Dusty Rhodes & Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) defeated Tom Shaft & Killer Karl Kox… Round 2: Jack & Jerry Brisco defeated Ricky Fields & Buzz Sawyer… Austin Idol & Masked Superstar defeated Tony Atlas & Ray Candy… Round 3: Austin Idol & Masked Superstar defeated Dusty Rhodes & Mr. Wrestling II… Finals: Austin Idol & Masked Superstar defeated Jack & Jerry Brisco to win the Georgia tag team titles… Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) defeated Impostor Mr. Wrestling II (Joe Powell)… In a Steel Cage Match Loser Leave Town Match: Tommy Rich defeated Bobby Heenan… In a Lights Out Match: Ole Anderson & Thunderbolt Patterson defeated Ernie Ladd & Ivan Koloff.

In Jacksonville, FL: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes.

11-23-1979: St. Louis, MO: Kiel Auditorium: Attendance 8,672: Bulldog Bob Brown & The Turk defeat Gama Singh & Frank Hill 2 falls to 1… Ed Wiskowski defeats Tom Andrews… NWA World Women's champion The Fabulous Moolah defeats Winona Little Heart… Dick The Bruiser & Pat O'Connor defeat Dick Murdoch & King Kong (Bruiser) Brody by DQ… NWA Missouri champion Kevin Von Erich defeats Ox Baker… NWA World Heavyweight champion Harley Race defeats Gene Kiniski 2 falls to 1.

11-24-1979: In St. Petersburg, FL: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes.

11-26-1979: In West Palm Beach, FL at the Auditorium: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Steve Keirn.

11-28-1979: In Miami, FL: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race battled Manny Fernandez to a double count out.

11-30-1979: In a match which the WWF in the United States never acknowledged until the late 1990’s, Antonio Inoki defeated Bob Backlund in Tokushima, Japan for the WWF World heavyweight title.

In Atlanta, GA at the Municipal Auditorium: NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race battled Tommy Rich to a draw.

12-1979: Nelson Royal vacates the NWA World Junior title when he retires for the first time.

12-02-1979: In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 5,481: Ricky Morton beat The Avenger… Sonny King beat Koko Ware… Big Red beat Danny Davis… The Assassins (Don Bass & Roger Smith) beat Hector Guerrero & Steve Regal to win the Southern tag team titles… Billy Robinson beat Wayne Ferris & Larry Latham via DQ in a handicap match… CWA champion Jerry Lawler beat Austin Idol via DQ.

12-06-1979: New Japan Pro Wrestling: in Tokyo, Japan: Sumo Hall drawing 9,500: Yoshiaki Fujiwara beat Akira Maeda… Haruka Eigen beat Kuniaki Kobayashi… Kengo Kimura & Osamu Kido beat Junji Hirata & Kantaro Hoshino… Strong Kobayashi beat Nikolai Volkoff via DQ… Tatsumi Fujinami & Riki Choshu beat Greg Valentine & Pedro Morales via countout… Seiji Sakaguchi defeated Tiger Jeet Singh in a chain death match… Antonio Inoki fought Bob Backlund to a no contest at 27:19; Backlund had scored a pinfall after coming off the top rope, following outside distraction from Tiger Jeet Singh, however WWF President Hisashi Shinma overruled the decision and declared it a no contest; only the WWF title was on the line.

12-07-1979: Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) regains the Georgia title from Tommy Rich in Atlanta, GA.

12-10-1979: In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 5,981: Steve Regal beat Ken Wayne… Paul Ellering & Billy Robinson beat The Assassins (Don Bass & Roger Smith)… Koko Ware beat The Super Destroyer… Sonny King & Tojo Yamamoto beat Ricky Morton & Big Red… AWA World champion Nick Bockwinkel beat CWA champion Jerry Lawler via DQ.

Steve Keirn defeats Chavo Guerrero in Los Angeles to become the first NWA International Junior champion.

12-13-1979: All-Japan Pro Wrestling: in Tokyo, Japan: Sumo Hall drawing 12,000: Wahoo McDaniel & Frank Hill beat The Great Kojika & Motoshi Okuma… Mr. Wrestling (Tim Woods) & The Masked Strangler (Jose Rivera) beat Genichiro Tenryu & Akihisa Takachiho… Tor Kamata & Kintaro Oki beat Rocky Hata & Tiger Toguchi… Giant Baba & Jumbo Tsuruta beat Mil Mascaras & Dos Caras… Terry & Dory Funk, Jr. beat Abdullah the Butcher & The Sheik to win the 1979 Real World Tag League tournament.

12-14-1979: Los Angeles, CA: Olympic Auditorium: Attendance 10,000: Carlos Mata defeats Colosso Colosetti… Romero defeats Big Ben Alexander… The Twin Devils (Twin Devil 1 & Twin Devil 2) defeat Al Madril & Mando Guerrero… Victor Rivera defeats Wahoo McDaniel: Steel Cage Match: Chavo Guerrero defeats Bad News Allen.

12-17-1979: The WWF returns to Madison Square Garden. Bob Backlund faces Bobby Duncum in the main event. Backlund appears without the WWF title belt. No official announcement is made of the situation with Antonio Inoki that occurred in Japan. Inoki is on the same card facing Great Hossien (the Iron Sheik) with the World Martial Arts title belt. When the show is aired in Japan it is announced that the Backlund verses Duncum match was for the “vacant” WWF title. Attendance: 20,255: WWF Intercontinental champion Pat Patterson defeated Dominic DeNucci… NWA World heavyweight champion Harley Race defeated Dusty Rhodes… Antonio Inoki defeated Great Hossien… WWF World Junior champion Tatsumi Fujinami defeated Johnny Rivera… WWF World tag team champions Ivan Putski & Tito Santana defeated Victor Rivera & Swede Hanson… Hulk Hogan defeated Ted DiBiase… North American tag team champions Seiji Sakaguchi & Riki Choshu defeated Allen Coage (Bad News Allen) & Jojo Andrews… Mike Graham defeated Johnny Rodz… Larry Zbyszko defeated Bulldog Brower.

12-21-1979: Dynamite Kid & Sekigawa defeated Leo Burke & Hubert Gallant in the finals of a tournament in Calgary, Canada to win the Stampede International tag team titles.

12-25-1979: Sangre India dies during a match in Mexico City after missing a tope and breaking his neck. He was 23 years old. EMLL held its usual Tuesday night show at La Arena Coliseo in Mexico City. Sangre India was in the semifinal teaming with Leo Lopez against El Vengador and Cesar Atlas Curiel, the man with whom Sangre India was to be feuding at the time and the father of later CMLL wrestler Neutron. In the first fall, Jose gave Sangre India two very strong chops. Cesar, who responded with an Irish whip and dropkick, knocking Sangre India over the top rope and outside of the ring. He fell down head first, cracking his neck and upper back full force against the ring apron and then the floor. He reached out his hand and slammed the ring canvas once. As he tried to do so again, he fell down face first against the floor and cutting a big gash in his chin. The ring doctor, Reynaldo Garcia Ramirez, was in attendance and ran over to help. The match was stopped. By all accounts, Sangre India died within seconds, almost surely of a broken neck.

At the Municipal Auditorium in Atlanta, GA: In a Steel Cage Match: Mask vs Mask: Mr. Wrestling II (Johnny Walker) defeated Impostor Mr. Wrestling II (Joe Powell)… Ole Anderson & Thunderbolt Patterson defeated Ivan Koloff & Alexis Smirnoff by DQ with special referees Gene Anderson & Tom Shaft… In a No DQ match: Masked Superstar (Bill Eadie) defeated Dick Slater… Abdullah the Butcher defeated Tony Atlas… WWF champion Bob Backlund defeated Kevin Sullivan… Ric Flair battled Austin Idol to a no contest… In a Judo Jacket match: Killer Khan defeated Bob Armstrong… Tommy Rich & Ray Candy defeated Ernie Ladd & Ox Baker… Steve Travis battled Toru Tanaka to a draw.

In Memphis, TN: Mid-South Coliseum drawing 6,487: Buddy Wayne beat Jerry Bryant.. Slim the Hillbilly beat Ken Wayne… Paul Ellering beat The Grappler (Len Denton)… Steve Regal beat Jimmy Hart… Ricky & Robert Gibson beat Southern tag team champions The Assassins (Don Bass & Roger Smith) via DQ… Ricky Morton & Big Red beat Tojo Yamamoto & Sonny King in a Texas death match… Jerry Lawler beat Steve Regal… Jerry Lawler beat Ken Lucas.

12-29-1979: WWF: Baltimore, MD: Civic Center: Attendance: 11,000: Davey O'Hannon pinned Joe Mascara… Jose Estrada pinned Ben Ortiz… Johnny Rodz pinned Angelo Gomez… Bulldog Brower pinned Mike Masters… Andre the Giant & Larry Zbyszko & Tito Santana & Dominic DeNucci defeated Swede Hanson & Jimmy Valiant & Johnny Valiant & Jerry Valiant… WWF champion Bob Backlund pinned WWF Intercontinental champion Pat Patterson in a lumberjack match.

12-30-1979: In Toronto, Canada at the Maple Leaf Gardens: WWWF champion Bob Backlund defeated Pat Patterson… Jimmy Snuka & Ray Stevens defeated Ric Flair & Dewey Robertson… Andre the Giant defeated The Destroyer & Brute Bernard in a handicap match… Johnny Weaver defeated Frank Monte… Billy Red Lyons defeated John Bonello… Sweet Daddy Siki defeated John Forsythe.
